{"id":1407585703,"question_id":3483,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4 months, 1 week","timestamp":1727734733,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"59 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1407585703/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Alternating Groups II","memory":"112.8 MB","code":"/*\nThere is a circle of red and blue tiles. You are given an array of integers colors and an integer k. The color of tile i is represented by colors[i]:\ncolors[i] == 0 means that tile i is red.\ncolors[i] == 1 means that tile i is blue.\nAn alternating group is every k contiguous tiles in the circle with alternating colors (each tile in the group except the first and last \none has a different color from its left and right tiles).\nReturn the number of alternating groups.\nNote that since colors represents a circle, the first and the last tiles are considered to be next to each other.\n\n3 <= colors.length <= 105\n0 <= colors[i] <= 1\n3 <= k <= colors.length\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    int numberOfAlternatingGroups(vector<int>& colors, int k) { //3 <= colors.length <= 105; 0 <= colors[i] <= 1; 3 <= k <= colors.length\n       unsigned int n = colors.size();\n        if( n < k )\n            return 0;\n        vector<int> circle_colors = colors;\n        circle_colors.insert( circle_colors.end(), colors.begin(), colors.end() );\n        \n        int count = 0;\n        int streak = 1;\n        for(int i=1; i<=n-1+k-1; i++) {\n            if(circle_colors[i] != circle_colors[i-1])\n                streak++;\n            else\n                streak = 1;\n            if(streak >= k )\n                count++;\n        }\n        \n        return count;        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"alternating-groups-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
